headline: Tesla’s Cybercab Backup Plan: Sell It With a Steering Wheel
summary: “If we have to have a steering wheel, it can have a steering wheel and pedals,” Robyn Denholm, the chair of Tesla’s board of directors, told Bloomberg News in an interview Tuesday.  The comments from Denholm, who’s going all-out to sell shareholders on the merits of an unprecedented pay package for Elon Musk, signify some crucial wiggle room in Tesla’s product roadmap.

raw.headline: Tesla’s Cybercab Backup Plan: Sell It With a Steering Wheel

headline: Pure Storage and Cisco Deliver AI Factories for the Enterprise with NVIDIA
summary: Pure Storage® (NYSE: PSTG) and Cisco (NASDAQ: CSCO) today announced a new FlashStack® Cisco Validated Design (CVD), adding to the collection of AI PODs, a key module within the Cisco Secure AI Factory with NVIDIA. The collaboration brings together compute, storage, networking, and software in one unified, production-grade platform to help enterprises move from AI pilot projects to large-scale deployment with confidence.

The collaboration brings together compute, storage, networking, and software in one unified, production-grade platform to help enterprises move from AI pilot projects to large-scale deployment with confidence.

headline: Nvidia, Lucid team up for true autonomous driving in future vehicles
summary: Lucid and Nvidia announced that they are teaming up to bring Level 4 autonomous driving, akin to a Waymo robotaxi, to future Lucid vehicles.

headline: What Recent Developments Could Shift the Narrative for GM?
summary: General Motors stock has seen its fair value estimate rise sharply, with analysts now valuing shares at $72.04 compared to the previous estimate of $63.80. This upgrade comes as ongoing research highlights both improved business visibility and robust operational performance. Stay tuned to discover how you can monitor these evolving analyst narratives and stay informed on future forecasts for GM stock. headline: Layoffs Mount Across Corporate America
summary: Turning to Corporate America... Job cuts are starting to pile up this year, with UPS the latest name to join the growing list of companies announcing layoffs in recent days including Amazon, GM and Target. Stuart Paul, US Economist for Bloomberg Economics joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the corporate cutbacks.

headline: Trump Ad Spat Exposes Ontario Premier’s Anxiety Over Fragile Auto Sector
summary: “Our goal is to make sure that we get a fair deal, not a one-sided Donald Trump deal,” Ford told reporters on Monday during a news conference devoted entirely to trade issues and the furor over the ad.  “And I’m focused on auto.”

raw.headline: Trump Ad Spat Exposes Ontario Premier’s Anxiety Over Fragile Auto Sector

headline: Electric Vehicle Sales Plummet as Federal Government Rolls Back $7,500 Sales Incentive; EV Inventories Cut Nearly In Half Since June
summary: Electric vehicle sales at auto dealerships around the country have dropped by 74% from their 2025 peak following the elimination of the $7,500 Federal tax incentive formalized by the "Big Beautiful Bill" signing. The findings are part of Cloud Theory's quarterly automotive industry report "On the Horizon" (Q3 2025 On the Horizon) released today.

headline: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From General Motors’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: General Motors’ third quarter results were met with a positive market reaction, as the company surpassed Wall Street’s revenue and adjusted profit expectations despite flat year-over-year sales.
